expectations.text: An AGENTS.md file exists in the outputs directory
The file contains a section describing the project's directory structure
expectations.evidence: Project overview section (lines 6-9): src/api/, src/workers/, src/shared/ with purpose annotations

expectations.text: The file includes build and test commands
expectations.evidence: Development section (lines 21-28) and Testing section (lines 40-45) with all npm scripts

expectations.text: The file mentions the key technologies
expectations.evidence: Tech stack section (lines 12-19): TypeScript, Express, Prisma, Redis/ioredis, BullMQ, Zod, Biome, Vitest

expectations.text: The file mentions database migration or seeding commands
expectations.evidence: Database section (lines 30-38): db:migrate, db:seed, db:studio with note about ordering

expectations.text: The file does not contain generic filler
expectations.evidence: No 'npm install' anywhere. No verbose explanations of obvious commands. Every line adds value.

expectations.text: Commands are formatted as bullet list items rather than headings with code blocks
expectations.evidence: Development (lines 23-28), Database (lines 32-36), and Testing (lines 42-45) all use ```bash code blocks, not bullet list items

expectations.text: The file includes at least one project-specific gotcha or convention discovered from reading the source code
expectations.evidence: Architecture notes (lines 47-52): $transaction atomicity pattern in sync worker, centralized Redis singleton in shared/redis.ts, REDIS_URL default. Conventions (lines 54-59): Biome not ESLint, Zod for validation.
